column1: 2 ^ Notus in Judéa Deus~; in Israhéle magnum nomen ejus. ^ In Judea God is known~; his name is great in Israel.
3 ^ Et factus est in pace locus ejus
column2: et habitátio ejus in Sióne. ^ And his place is in peace

column4: et bellum. ^ There hath he broken the powers of bows

column1: 5 ^ Illúminans tu mirabìliter a mòntibus aĕtèrnîs. ^ Thou enlightenest wonderfully from the everlasting hills.
6 ^ Turbáti sunt òmnes insapièntes corde~; dormivérunt somnum suum
column2: et nìhil invenérunt òmnes vìri divitiárum in mánibus suîs. ^ All the foolish of heart were troubled~; they have slept their sleep
column3: and all the men of riches have found nothing in their hands.
dormitavérunt qŭi ascensérunt èqŭos. ^ At thy rebuke
column5: they have all slumbered that mounted on horseback.

column2: ¿~et qŭìs resìstet tìbi~? Èx tunc ira tua. ^ Thou art terrible
column3: and who shall resist thee~? From that time is thy wrath.

column1: 9 ^ De caĕlo aŭdítum fecìsti judìcium~; terra trémuit et quiévit
column2: ^ Thou hast caused judgment to be heard from heaven~; the earth trembled and was still
ut salvos fáceret òmnes mansuétos terraĕ. ^ when God arose in judgment
column3: to save all the meek of the earth.

column2: et relìquiaĕ cogitatiónis diem festum agent tìbi. ^ For the thought of man shall give praise to thee
column3: and the remainders of the thought shall keep holiday to thee.

column1: 12 ^ Vovéte et rèddite Dòmino Deo vèstro~; òmnes qŭi in circùmitu ejus affèrtis múnera terrìbili
column3: and pay to the Lord your God~; all you that are round about him bring presents to him that is terrible

column1: 13 ^ et ei qŭi aŭfert spíritum princìpium~; terrìbili apud reges terraĕ. ^ and to him who taketh away the spirit of princes~; to the terrible before the kings of the earth.
